articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: With no sign of progress in mediators' efforts to reach a ceasefire in the Gaza war, Israeli forces pounded Rafah from the air and ground overnight as tanks tried to advance further west, residents said.
articles.title: Israeli forces step up bombing of Rafah, tanks push west

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Michel Rose
articles.description: Fresh from commemorating the 80th anniversary of D-Day, French President Emmanuel Macron will host U.S. President Joe Biden on Saturday for a state visit marked by pomp and a parade as well as talks on trade, Israel and Ukraine.
articles.title: Biden, Macron to discuss Israel and Ukraine in pomp-filled state visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday there was no need to use nuclear weapons to deliver victory for Moscow in Ukraine, the strongest signal yet from the Kremlin chief that there will not be a nuclear strike.
articles.title: Putin says Russia does not need to use nuclear weapons for victory in Ukraine

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has added Israel's military to a global list of offenders who have committed violations against children, said Israel's U.N. envoy Gilad Erdan, describing the decision as "shameful."
articles.title: UN chief to call out Israel for violations against children

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in Vietnam have arrested two well-known Vietnamese Facebook users on charges of abusing democratic freedoms, the government said on Saturday, as a major leadership reshuffle in the Communist-ruled country is settling down.
articles.title: Vietnam arrests two well-known Facebook users over democratic freedom abuse

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Malaysian authorities defended their decision to evict hundreds of sea nomads from their homes off the coast of Sabah state this week, saying it was aimed at boosting security and combating cross-border crime.
articles.title: Malaysia defends eviction of sea nomads, citing security concerns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen walked away following an assault by a man in central Copenhagen on Friday and had no outward signs of harm, a local resident told Reuters.
articles.title: Denmark's Prime Minister Frederiksen assaulted in central Copenhagen, man arrested

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A charity rescue ship recovered the bodies of 11 migrants off the coast of Libya on Friday after saving more than 160 people from boats close to the North African country, the Doctors Without Borders (MSF) group said.
articles.title: Rescue charity recovers 11 bodies from sea off Libya

articles.author: Peter Cooney, Steve Gorman
articles.description: Retired astronaut William Anders, who was one of the first three humans to orbit the moon, capturing the famed "Earthrise" photo during NASA's Apollo 8 mission in 1968, died on Friday in the crash of a small airplane in Washington state. He was 90.
articles.title: Apollo 8 astronaut William Anders, who took 'Earthrise' photo, dead in plane crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: UNICEF, the U.N. children's agency, appealed on Friday for international aid to help prepare violence-plagued Haiti for a dangerous Atlantic hurricane season that could be deadly for the island's many displaced people.
articles.title: U.N. agency appeals for aid to help Haiti weather hurricane season
